newsitem.title: USA: TENNIS-NOVOTNA ADVANCES IN FLORIDA, CAPRIATI IS INJURED.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-NOVOTNA ADVANCES IN FLORIDA, CAPRIATI IS INJURED.

text.p: Top seed Jana
Novotna of Czech Republic won a 4-6 6-4 6-0 second-round match
at the Bausch &Lomb Championships, and two prominent players
withdrew because of injuries on Wednesday.
Defending champion Irina Spirlea of Romania and Jennifer
Capriati of the U.S. were the latest players to be forced out
of the $450,000 tournament for health reasons.
On Tuesday, Monica Seles withdrew with bronchitis and a
fever.
On the court, 16-year-old Venus Williams lost to Chanda
Rubin 6-4 6-0 in a 62-minute, second-round match.
Also winning second-round matches Wednesay were eighth
seed Iva Majoli of Croatia, ninth seed Mary Joe Fernandez of
the U.S., 11th seed Mary Pierce of France, 12th seed Amanda
Coetzer of South Africa and 13th seed Brenda Schultz-McCarthy
of the Netherlands.
A sprained right wrist forced the seventh seeded Spirlea
to withdraw. As a result wild-card entrant Marlene Weingartner
of Germany advanced to the third round.
"Last year, it was my best tournament and this is my best
memory, being here," Spirlea said. "I was saying to my coach
before coming here, how much I was really looking forward to
playing Amelia because after a few wins, being there feels
like it's home."
The 27th-ranked Capriati, who is not scheduled to play
again until Rome the first week in May, suffered a groin
injury and could not play in her scheduled match against lucky
loser Mariana Diaz Oliva.
"It's very disappointing, it's a bummer," Capriati said.
"I have to rest it at least for a few more days for it to
fully recover. I've been playing really well, so I felt I had
chances here."
At 4-4 in the first set, the fourth-ranked Novotna played
two tentative games to lose the set.
In the second set, Novotna went ahead 5-2 and was serving
for the set in the eighth game. She failed to take advantage
of five set points in the eighth game and had to wait until
serving in the 10th game to even the score at one set apiece.
Novotna played spectacular tennis in the third set, never
losing a game and winning 25 of the 36 points in the set.
"I felt I was playing pretty good tennis even though I
lost the first set," Novotna said. "I was serving big today."
The 30th-ranked Rubin and 102nd-ranked Williams played
each other close for the first eight games of the match.
That's when Rubin took over, winning the final eight games.
Rubin lost only six points in her final four service games.
At first, Rubin had difficulty dealing with Williams'
serve, but then she started to control the match by dictating
the points.
"She has the power and she has the shots, but moving her
around the court definitely was to my advantage," Rubin said.
"By the end of the first set, I was playing well and took her
out of her game."
Willams said of the loss, "I don't thnk I did too much
wrong, it's just Chanda did everything right. She didn't give
me any opportunities back, she capitalised on everything."
